articles.title: Chin-Powered Energy Is Now Possible, Say Scientists (TIME)

articles.author: Ken Kremer
articles.summary:
The ‘head’ of the bizarre comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko has been selected as
the primary landing site for the Rosetta spacecrafts attached Philae lander,
attempting mankind’s first ever landing on a comet in mid-November. Scientists
leading the European Space Agency’s Rosetta mission announced the primary
landing site at a media briefing today, Sept. 15, at ESA
headquarters.(...)Read […]
articles.title: Comet’s Head Selected as Landing Site for Rosetta’s Historic Philae Lander (Universe Today)

that, despite what we thought we knew, magnetism is nothing but quantum
mechanics.

vacant, million-dollar home in a posh Miami suburb, pointing ultrasonic
microphones at the darkened mansion.

articles.title: Resilient Monk Parrots Flock to Queens and Beyond (New York Times)

articles.summary:
New research shows that schizophrenia isn't a single disease but a group of
eight genetically distinct disorders, each with its own set of symptoms. The
finding could be a first step toward improved diagnosis and treatment for the
debilitating psychiatric illness.The research at Washington University School
of Medicine in St. Louis is reported online Sept. 15 in the American Journal
of Psychiatry.
articles.title: Schizophrenia not a single disease but multiple genetically distinct disorders (Eurekalert)

stem cells, a process … Read More
articles.title: STAP Co-author Offers Yet Another Recipe for Stem Cells (bioethicscom)
